item.title: From C# To F# And Back Again: Lambdas And More. - Dream.In.Code
item.description: View blog. Posts: 11,844; Joined: 16-October 07. Posted 16 minutes ago. As a language standard, C# has come a very long way since its creation, when it was little more than Java for .NET. In the spanning years, it has thrown off Java's OO ... What is F#? Isn't it that thing frustrated Scala programmers use in .NET? Isn't it only useful for math stuff? To quote: Quote. F# is a succinct, expressive, and efficient functional and object-oriented language for Microsoft .NET that helps you write ...

item.title: Master F# with Ted Neward! | Bellevue College Continuing Education
item.description: Blog. Master F# with Ted Neward! Ted Neward describes himself as “a big geek who takes great pride in making other geeks into bigger, better, more highly rewarded geeks.” Beginning with C++, Ted has spent the last 15 years diving into the tech industry. He's been working with .NET since before it ... F# to your professional tool kit,” Ted notes. “This hybrid object-functional language offers the best of both worlds by making it easy to do what objects do well and what functions do well. ” ...

item.description: Naturally, I thought of how nice it would be to use the power of F# to create the script, but I had no time to figure out how to trick SSIS into using Fscript instead of a C# or VB script. What a natural fit ... This is a functional member. You just have to love functional programming with its functional first class citizenship. F# Response Module.
